intro: Xysmalobium andongense, commonly known as the Andong lily, is a rare flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants known for their distinctive leaf structures and often showy flowers. The plant is characterized by its slender stems and clusters of small, pale pink to white flowers that bloom in late spring. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in mountainous regions. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a conservation concern.
